Description: If column(s) "Declared Type" or/and "Actual Type" of Layout is/are selected, errors come up at debugging. This may not be DBCS specific issue.
 Build date: M6, IBM JRE 5.0 SR-1
 OS: WIndowsXP Japanese sp2
        Steps to recreate problem:
        1- create HelloWorld appli and set break point, then run debug
        2- select "Declared Type" and "Actual Type" at layout > Select Columns (screenshot 1.JPG)
        3- click "step into" (screenshot 2.JPG), and expand the tree of Variables view
        
Result (screenshot 3.JPG)

I can make it happen on my machine using an English locale.
*** Bug 134293 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Two problems fixed here:

(1) the async request was "performing update" even when the request failed (in this case there were null labels, causing SWT to explode) - Fixed in AsynchronousRequestMonitor.

(2) The labels did not need to be null - the decalred type information was not available from the target in this case, so should just display "<unknown type>" in columns as tree presentation does. Fixed in JavaVariableLabelAdapter.
*** Bug 133219 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
